p: The findings by Zhou and colleagues highlight interactions of the entering SARS-CoV-2 virus with host factors; specifically those interactions with the ‘corona’ of spike (S) proteins projecting from virus membranes. The most threatening bat-derived CoVs are those with distinctively human-tropic S proteins ( Figure 1 , top). Once inside human lungs ( Figure 1, bottom), S proteins interact with host susceptibility factors, including receptors and proteases, which causes massive protein conformational changes triggering virus–cell membrane fusion and infection. S-specific neutralizing antibodies and antiviral agents interfere with these susceptibility factors and protect from infection.
